paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?

paragraphs.content: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.

paragraphs.content: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

paragraphs.content: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.

paragraphs.content: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
paragraphs.contentHtml: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)

paragraphs.content: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
paragraphs.contentHtml: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

paragraphs.content: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

paragraphs.content: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

paragraphs.content: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;
paragraphs.contentHtml: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

paragraphs.content: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
paragraphs.contentHtml: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:

paragraphs.content: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.

paragraphs.content: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

paragraphs.content: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:

paragraphs.content: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:

paragraphs.content: Their feet are swift to shed blood:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their feet are swift to shed blood:

paragraphs.content: Destruction and misery are in their ways:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Destruction and misery are in their ways:

paragraphs.content: And the way of peace have they not known:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the way of peace have they not known:

paragraphs.content: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

paragraphs.content: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

paragraphs.content: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.

paragraphs.content: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

paragraphs.content: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:

paragraphs.content: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

paragraphs.content: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

paragraphs.content: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

paragraphs.content: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.

paragraphs.content: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.

paragraphs.content: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

paragraphs.content: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:

paragraphs.content: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

paragraphs.content: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
